intro: Rauvolfia salicifolia var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed Indian snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species with medicinal properties. Its roots and leaves have been traditionally used in herbal medicine for their potential health benefits.
